keyPoints: 15+ rapid-fire definitions collected via speed round
Sufficiency cluster: 'having what you need when you need it'
Generosity cluster: 'more than enough', 'overflow'
Systems/regenerative cluster: 'self-renewing', 'flourishing'
Psychological/spiritual cluster: 'state of mind', 'lack of fear'
Relational cluster: 'being valued by others'
Tension: objective condition vs subjective experience vs systemic quality

Abundance Spectrum.watchFor: Which abundance definitions show up in practice? Applied how?

keyPoints: Call 05: 'Has OGM done sense-making or just salon conversations?'

keyPoints: John's epiphany: 'Why one-on-ones with ChatGPT instead of AI as group participant?'

Practical tools already working: Stacey's podcast converter, Jerry's anonymized focus groups, Shawn's Thinkertoys

Doug: common understanding for better decision-making in complex systems

keyPoints: How do we handle news that doesn't fit our worldview?
Trump Gaza ceasefire and Venezuela progress challenging left-leaning group
Al Chang insight: Same facts, different movie scripts - left and right can't read each other's narratives
Gil models worldview permeability: 'cautiously impressed... challenges my picture of bumbling baby guy'
Mike's 'cosplay diplomacy' critique: temporary deals without substance, will fail like Afghanistan
Mike's personal shock: Carnegie colleague with 1000+ classified docs - 'completely disconnect from everything I know'
Jerry using Claude/ChatGPT to steel-man Trump's claims
Do we allow worldviews to be permeable to contradictory information?

Worldview Challenges and Narratives.watchFor: Other worldview challenges, AI used for perspective-taking, examples of worldview updates or resistance

keyPoints: Meta-question: Has progress stopped?
Immediate fragmentation on definition - Mike: 'we'll talk past each other'
Alex: Big interests now work AGAINST progress (exception: computing/IT)
Hegemonic interests suppressing disruptive innovation (super battery example)
Jerry: Great American Streetcar Conspiracy - GM/Firestone killed public transit
Gil: Progress highly localized (US vs Europe) - renewable energy, personal medical advances, home tech
Mike's 5+ progress dimensions: scientific, technological, economic barriers, societal
Progress as transformation of daily life (electrification, hygiene) vs behind-the-curtain improvements
Jerry skeptical of flying cars: 'maybe real progress is NOT pushing addictive technology on us'
Progress and Vested Interests.evolution: Call 12 raises fundamental question, immediately encounters definition problem
Progress and Vested Interests.watchFor: Examples of vested interests suppressing innovation, progress metrics debates, European vs US comparisons

emergingPatterns: Core group can hold both heavy trauma processing and lighter topical discussions
Personal stories (Kevin) illustrate theoretical discussions (Call 01 grief)
Systems-level thinking across multiple domains (Mike Nelson, Klaus Mager pattern)
Trust is central: personal trust (Call 01), information trust (Call 03), reality trust (Call 04)
Historical trauma connects to current conflicts (WWII → Gaza)
Definition obsession: group returns repeatedly to definitional questions (sense-making, collaboration, abundance, OGM itself, progress)
Meta-comfortable: group comfortable turning lens on itself (Calls 05, 09, 10)
Process over outcomes: tension continues but increasing acceptance of salon culture
Cognitive diversity as asset: explicitly valued over consensus (Alex in Call 09)
Theory vs practice gap: discuss collaboration (Call 07) but struggle to implement infrastructure (Call 09)
Intimacy preference: small group, deep connections over scale (Jerry: one Zoom screen max)
Platform frustration recurring: no good answers for community tools (Call 09)
Federal government failure theme growing: Kevin, Rob, Klaus all frustrated with federal institutions (Calls 04, 06)
Technology interrogation escalates: Call 10 practical AI tools → Call 11 AI for perspective-taking → Call 12 AI making things worse
Jerry's frustrated vision persists: 'build a global mind... We haven't done much of that at all' (Calls 09, 10)
Worldview permeability question: Can we update our narratives with contradictory information? (Call 11)
Parallel realities pattern: Different groups see same facts through incompatible narrative scripts (Call 11)
questionsToTrack: How do societies process grief well vs. poorly?
What replaces journalism as it dies?
How do we coordinate fragmented community initiatives?
Why is there a business model for spreading disinformation but not for fighting it?
How do institutions protect perpetrators?
What happens to communities when federal disaster support fails?
How do we know what's real when AI generates convincing fakes? (Call 04)
Can we have shared facts without shared narratives? (Call 04)
How do democracies tolerate obvious corruption? (Call 04)
What do we mean by 'sense' and 'sense-making'? (Call 05)
Should sense-making have a goal or is exploration the point? (Call 05)
How do we balance goals/deadlines with open exploration? (Call 05)
What are 'third places' and how do they enable community coordination? (Call 06)
How long does it take low-status neighborhoods to recover from disasters? (Call 06: New Orleans 20 years)
Can AI help coordinate splintered movements without massive databases? (Call 06: Klaus's vision)
Can you have collaboration without identical shared vision? (Call 07)
When is extended definitional dialogue valuable vs frustrating? (Calls 05, 07, 08)
Is abundance objective condition, subjective experience, or systemic quality? (Call 08)
Do we want to grow? If so, in what ways? (Call 09: central OGM question)
Is OGM a salon or should it create bodies of work? (Call 09)
How do we enable 'who's doing what with whom' discovery without violating privacy? (Call 09: Pete's paradox)
What tool should new communities use? Why hasn't software solved this? (Call 09: Jerry's frustration)
Can likes/comments work at small scale without statistical throughput? (Call 09)
Why are we having one-on-ones with ChatGPT instead of AI as group participant? (Call 10: John's central question)
Is enshittification tightly correlated with monetization? (Call 10: Gil's deep question)
Can platforms sustain economically without volunteer labor or enshittification? (Call 10)
How do we get to common understanding at semantic level without requiring agreement? (Call 10: Doug)
Why is Jerry's 'global mind' vision not happening? (Calls 09, 10)
How do we handle news that doesn't fit our worldview? (Call 11)
Do we allow our worldviews to be permeable? (Call 11)
How do we steel-man opposing narratives? (Call 11: Jerry's method)
Is Trump's diplomacy real or cosplay? (Call 11: Mike's question)
How do we see each other's narratives across left-right divide? (Call 11)
When does surprising abundance become a coordination challenge? (Call 11: Kevin's Mennonites)
Has progress stopped? (Call 12: the meta-question)
What IS progress? (Call 12: immediate fragmentation)
Are there more barriers to technological development than in the past? (Call 12: Mike's narrowing)
Why do vested interests suppress disruptive progress? (Call 12: Alex's framework)
Is progress transformation of daily life, or deeper systemic change? (Call 12)
Why aren't technological breakthroughs leading to quality of life improvements? (Call 12: Enshittification)
Is progress localized (Europe vs US) rather than global? (Call 12: Gil's observation)

frameworks: The Mapping Not the Map (Gene Bellinger)
tools: Anonymized focus group app (Jerry, name forgotten)

Kevin Jones Hurricane Helene Journey.status: MIRACLE - Transformed from victim to recovery leader
Kevin Jones Hurricane Helene Journey.progression: Call 01: Fled to Europe → Call 02: Moving to Asheville, giving up, 'throat level sadness' → Call 06: Finding role helping Swannanoa without being in sadness → Calls 07-09: ABSENT → Call 10: Minimal return → Call 11: MENNONITE MIRACLE - 25 carpenters building 20 houses FREE, rehab Kevin's house, massive breakthrough

call11miracle.impact: 25 old-order Mennonite carpenters coming to Swannanoa
call11miracle.scope: Build ~20 houses for FREE (Nov-May), possibly repeat next year
call11miracle.personal: Will rehab Kevin's house for free, living on his farm
call11miracle.context: 1 in 6 houses in low-status neighborhood destroyed (~400 houses)
call11miracle.significance: Labor on 20 houses no longer in fundraising math - massive cost savings
call11miracle.kevinTone: Amazingly, surprisingly good. 'Sometimes there are days like that.'
